sentences.english: This is not to say that the blind belief of sentimentality.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是说，对于滥情的盲目相信。

sentences.english: Can no longer be such to be saved, for students.
sentences.chinese: 能不能不再这样，以滥情为存生。

sentences.english: Bloom is a true emotional spendthrift who uses his feelings lavishly.
sentences.chinese: 布卢姆是个真正的滥情者。

sentences.english: Middle aged Simpson hasn't got married yet as he likes playing the field.
sentences.chinese: 辛普森过于滥情，人到中年还没结婚。

sentences.english: But because of ignorant overflows the sentiment. Because ignorant only then is injured.
sentences.chinese: 因为愚昧而去滥情因为懵懂才去受伤。

sentences.english: But I know who these gushing with feelings, no one is not empty.
sentences.chinese: 但我所了解的这些滥情者，没有一个是不空虚的。

sentences.english: I am a great respect for the feelings of the people, but emotions do not spread.
sentences.chinese: 我是个非常尊重感情的人，但是不滥情。

sentences.english: People are far more promiscuous, it seems, on foreign holidays.
sentences.chinese: 在外国度假时，人们似乎会很更滥情。

definition: fickle (in love affairs)/dissipated/unfaithful/heart of a flower (pistil and stamen)
to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty/never satisfied with what one has
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
to fall into bad company/to make acquaintances indiscriminately
lit. say three in the morning but four in the evening (idiom); to change sth that is already settled upon/indecisive/to blow hot and cold
lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
to have a foot in both camps/to have a bet each way/to be having an affair
